org.springframework.integration.dsl.context

Class IntegrationFlowContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.integration.dsl.context.IntegrationFlowContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.Aware, org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanFactoryAware

    public final class IntegrationFlowContext
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanFactoryAware
    A public API for dynamic (manual) registration of IntegrationFlow, not via standard bean registration phase.

    The bean of this component is provided via framework automatically. A bean name is based on the decapitalized class name. It must be injected to the target service before use.

    The typical use-case, and, therefore algorithm, is:

    • create IntegrationFlow depending of the business logic
    • register that IntegrationFlow in this IntegrationFlowContext, with optional id and autoStartup flag
    • obtain a MessagingTemplate for that IntegrationFlow (if it is started from the MessageChannel) and send (or send-and-receive) messages to the IntegrationFlow
    • remove the IntegrationFlow by its id from this IntegrationFlowContext

    For convenience an associated IntegrationFlowRegistration is returned after registration. It can be used for access to the target IntegrationFlow or for manipulation with its lifecycle.

    Since:
    1.2
    Author:
    Artem Bilan
    See Also:
    IntegrationFlowRegistration

      • messagingTemplateFor

        public org.springframework.integration.core.MessagingTemplate messagingTemplateFor(java.lang.String flowId)
        Obtain a MessagingTemplate with its default destination set to the input channel of the IntegrationFlow for provided flowId.

        Any IntegrationFlow bean (not only manually registered) can be used for this method.

        If IntegrationFlow doesn't start with the MessageChannel, the IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        flowId - the bean name to obtain the input channel from
        Returns:
        the MessagingTemplate instance
